intro: Scrophularia olympica var. ruprechtii, commonly known as the Olympic Scrophularia, is a rare flowering plant native to the Olympic Peninsula in Washington State. It is a member of the Scrophulariaceae family, characterized by its tubular flowers and hairy stems. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks. It produces showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
